articles.title: The trap Anthropic built for itself
articles.summary: Anthropic, OpenAI, Google DeepMind and others have long promised to govern themselves responsibly. Now, in the absence of rules, there's not a lot to protect them.

articles.title: Anthropic’s Claude rises to No. 2 in the App Store following Pentagon dispute
articles.summary: Anthropic’s chatbot Claude seems to have benefited from the attention around the company’s fraught negotiations with the Pentagon.

articles.title: The billion-dollar infrastructure deals powering the AI boom

articles.title: OpenAI’s Sam Altman announces Pentagon deal with ‘technical safeguards’
articles.summary: OpenAI's CEO claims its new defense contract includes protections addressing the same issues that became a flashpoint for Anthropic.

articles.title: Pentagon moves to designate Anthropic as a supply-chain risk
articles.summary: "We don't need it, we don't want it, and will not do business with them again," the president wrote in the post.

articles.title: Musk bashes OpenAI in deposition, saying ‘nobody committed suicide because of Grok’
articles.summary: In his lawsuit against OpenAI, Musk touted xAI safety compared with ChatGPT. A few months later, xAI's Grok flooded X with nonconsensual nude images.

articles.title: In a Memoir Draft, Changpeng Zhao of Binance Details the Talks Leading to His Prison Time
articles.summary: In a draft of his memoir, Changpeng Zhao, the founder of Binance, laid out the secret negotiations that led to his imprisonment and a run-in with ICE.

articles.title: Silicon Valley Rallies Behind Anthropic in A.I. Clash With Trump
articles.summary: Actions by the president and the Pentagon appeared to drive a wedge between Washington and the tech industry, whose leaders and workers spoke out for the start-up.

articles.title: Pentagon-Anthropic Standoff Is a Decisive Moment for How A.I. Will Be Used in War
articles.summary: The Pentagon’s contract dispute with Anthropic is part of a wider clash about the use of artificial intelligence for national security and who decides on any safeguards.

articles.title: Elon Musk’s Secret Web of Companies in Texas
articles.summary: The megabillionaire was tied to about 90 companies in the state, which he uses for everything from paying nannies to buying land to supporting Donald Trump’s re-election, according to a Times examination.
